text: I always wrap my minified code in `{% raw %}` tags before uploading to prevent exactly this issue!
<@U3A4KEWK1> good idea, I write in SCSS so I might need to come up with some extra workaround...

If you use Gulp, you can use <https://www.npmjs.com/package/gulp-append-prepend|gulp-append-prepend> to add the tags in after the scss is compiled and minified. That's my workflow! I also do that with my minified JS, just in case.
<@U3A4KEWK1> I literally just pulled Gulp from my project in favor of using Webpack
I'll look around for something similar
Also, I don't think I really need to minify on my end
Although, I just double checked and HubSpot does minify CSS and JS but they don't appear to concatenate them together
For JS at least, I think HS won't minify it as much as you could locally - I think it just strips out whitespace and comments.
damn, I'll get on it then
Could be wrong - the rules for how that all works are a little mysterious.
doesn't look like JS files are combined either (from modules). Should be easy enough to combine them...
